Class ContactManagerImpl

java.lang.Object
  ContactManagerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContactManager
public class ContactManagerImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements ContactManager

ContactManagerImpl - Implements ContactManager interface. A class to manage your contacts and meetings.

addFutureMeeting

public int addFutureMeeting(java.util.Set<Contact> contacts,
                            java.util.Calendar date)
Add a new meeting to be held in the future.

Specified by:
addFutureMeeting in interface ContactManager
Parameters:
contacts - a list of contacts that will participate in the meeting.
date - the date on which the meeting will take place.
Returns:
the ID for the meeting.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the meeting is set for a time in the past, or if any contact is unknown.

getFutureMeetingList

public java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(Contact contact)
Returns the list of future meetings scheduled with this contact. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.

Specified by:
getFutureMeetingList in interface ContactManager
Parameters:
contact - one of the user's contacts.
Returns:
the list of the future meeting(s) scheduled with this contact (maybe empty).
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the contact does not exist.

getFutureMeetingList

public java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(java.util.Calendar date)
Returns the list of meetings that are scheduled for, or that took place on, the specified date. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.

Specified by:
getFutureMeetingList in interface ContactManager
Parameters:
date - the date.
Returns:
the list of meetings.

getPastMeetingList

public java.util.List<PastMeeting> getPastMeetingList(Contact contact)
Returns the list of past meeting in which this contact has participated. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.

Specified by:
getPastMeetingList in interface ContactManager
Parameters:
contact - one of the user's contacts.
Returns:
the list of past meeting(s) scheduled with this contact (maybe empty).
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the contact does not exist.

addNewPastMeeting

public void addNewPastMeeting(java.util.Set<Contact> contacts,
                              java.util.Calendar date,
                              java.lang.String text)
Create a new record for a meeting that took place in the past.

Specified by:
addNewPastMeeting in interface ContactManager
Parameters:
contacts - a list of participants.
date - the date on which the meeting took place.
text - messages to be added about the meeting.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the list of contacts is empty, or any of the contacts does not exist.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null.

addMeetingNotes

public void addMeetingNotes(int id,
                            java.lang.String text)
Add notes to a meeting. This method is used when a future meeting takes place, and is then converted to a past meeting (with notes). It can be also used to add notes to a past meeting at a later date.

Specified by:
addMeetingNotes in interface ContactManager
Parameters:
id - the ID of the meeting.
text - messages to be added about the meetings.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the meeting does not exist.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the meeting is set for a date in the future.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the notes are null.

addNewContact

public void addNewContact(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String notes)
Create a new contact with the specified name and notes.

Specified by:
addNewContact in interface ContactManager
Parameters:
name - the name of the contact.
notes - notes to be added about the contact.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the name or the notes are null.

getContacts

public java.util.Set<Contact> getContacts(int... ids)
Returns a list containing the contacts that correspond to the IDs.

Specified by:
getContacts in interface ContactManager
Parameters:
ids - an arbitrary number of contact IDs.
Returns:
a list containing the contacts that correspond to the IDs.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the IDs does not correspond to a real contact.

flush

public void flush()
Save all data to disk. This method must be executed when the program is closed and when/if the user requests it.

Specified by:
flush in interface ContactManager
